#Text=4 .
#Text=Simulation and Comparative Analysis
#Text=In this section , we will verify the control algorithm proposed in Section 3 by simulation .
#Text=In order to facilitate the simulation , we consider 2DOF flexible manipulator as the controlled object .
#Text=Firstly , the IHSMC algorithm proposed in this paper is simulated and compared with the traditional HSMC algorithm .
#Text=The superiority of the control strategy is verified .
#Text=Then , a PID-IDA-PBC proposed in this paper is simulated and implemented with the IDA-PBC algorithm .
#Text=In comparison , it is verified that the PID-IDA-PBC algorithm has better steady state performance and disturbance – resistance ability .
#Text=In the end , we proceed simulations using hybrid control .
#Text=We use the parameter values of robot manipulator reported in .
#Text=In this simulation we assume that each joint of the flexible-joint robot is driven by PMSM .
#Text=The parameters of PMSM are given as .
#Text=The initial state is set as , we require the expected position vector to be .
#Text=Lastly , we agree that the counterclockwise direction is the positive direction of the rotation of robot .
#Text=For the IHSMC algorithm , the selected controller parameters are , The parameter selection of the joint 1 current controller are .
#Text=The original HSMC control law can be expressed as ( 30 ) where .
#Text=According to the results shown in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=, joint 1 and joint 2 enter a steady state after a dynamic process of about 0.4 s , but there is still a small chattering in the system at steady state .
#Text=Compared with the original HSMC algorithm , the IHSMC algorithm has a faster response speed and chattering is effectively suppressed .
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=shows the simulation curves of under IHSMC and HSMC method .
#Text=The simulation experiment of the PID-IDA-PBC algorithm is divided into two parts .
#Text=Firstly , the performance difference between the algorithm and the traditional IDA-PBC algorithm is compared without disturbance .
#Text=Then , a constant value disturbance signal of 2
#Text=N·m is added at the System dynamic Equation ( 2 ) at 4 s to verify the disturbance – resistance performance of the algorithm .
#Text=Parameters of PID-PBC-PCH controller : .
#Text=According to
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=, it can be concluded that the PID-IDA-PBC has improved dynamic performance and steady-state performance compared to the conventional IDA-PBC control .
#Text=The PID-IDA-PBC control algorithm can improve the steady-state performance by adjusting v .
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=shows the simulation curves of under IDA-PBC and PID-IDA-PBC method .
#Text=At the same time , it will reduce the dynamic performance .

#Text=In order to validate the robustness of the PID-IDA-PBC algorithm , constant-size perturbations of different sizes are added to the drive motors of joint 1 and joint 2 at 4 s. The result is shown in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=.
#Text=The PID-IDA-PBC algorithm has excellent disturbance – resistance performance .
#Text=According to the above , it can be concluded that a single control algorithm finds it difficult to balance both dynamic performance and steady state performance .
#Text=Therefore , this paper proposes a hybrid control strategy that attempts to combine the advantages of the two control algorithms .
#Text=The simulation experiment of the hybrid control strategy was divided into three parts .
#Text=First , we compared the control effects of hybrid control and single control algorithms .
#Text=Then , a disturbance was added at 4 s to verify the immunity of the hybrid control .
#Text=Finally , a simulation experiment was designed to analyze the effect of switching parameters on the effects of hybrid control .
#Text=The hybrid controller parameter selection is .
#Text=According to the simulation results in
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=, it can be concluded that the hybrid control strategy combines the advantages of the two control algorithms well , and has good dynamic performance and high tracking accuracy .
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=shows the simulation curves of under Hybrid control method .
#Text=The smoothing function curve in
#Text=Figure 9
#Text=reflects the proportion of PID-IDA-PBC control during the switching process .
#Text=Figure 10
#Text=is the trajectory curves when there is a disturbance imposed at the time of .
#Text=The result shows that even if the system generates small high-frequency chattering due to disturbance , it can eventually eliminate chattering .
#Text=The simulation results in
#Text=Figure 11
#Text=show that the control effect of the hybrid control strategy is related to the switching parameter c .
#Text=The curve with smooth switching function under different parameters is shown in
#Text=Figure 12
#Text=.
#Text=According to the results in
#Text=Figure 11
#Text=and
#Text=Figure 12
#Text=, it can be concluded that the effect of the hybrid control is affected by the parameter c and the switching interval .
#Text=The larger the c value , the earlier the position error change ratio is affected by the PID-IDA-PBC algorithm .
#Text=According to the value of c , the appropriate switching interval is selected to achieve smooth switching , and the abrupt change of the switching is avoided .
